title.narrative: F.a: Movement of Those Affected by Megaprojects

description.narrative: The project aims to increase the mozambican peasant communities? capacity to defend their rights and natural resources against the impacts of mining and agribusiness mega projects, as well as unite the communities into a bigger movement. The project consis ts of local level debate and training workshops on advocacy and campaigning, as well as of exchange of experiences between local communities. Injustice caused by mega projects and public policies supporting them are documented and published. ADECRU is stre ngthened institutionally and networking on national and international level is done through joint campaigning. The project benefits in particular peasant communities threathened by mining and agribusiness mega projects. Accao Academica para o Desenvolvimen to das Comunidades Rurais (ADECRU) was founded by students in 2007, and registered officially in 2009. It promotes rural communities' comprehensive development based on sovereignty, solidarity and justice. ADECRU's objectives include building of social mov ement through strengthening itself institutionally, influence on public decision-making regarding rural communities, fight for rural communities' collective rights on natural resources, land and culture and strengthen the visibility of youth's and women's priorities in national development programmes. ADECRU has no paid staff. It has 40 members and in addition approximately 60 activists mostly working in rural provinces.
